definitions: in terms of rhetoric or speech intended to impress or persuade

examples.text: in the modern world, everyone rhetorically embraces democracy
we will continue to fight an uphill battle, rhetorically speaking, against extremists

definitions: (with reference to a question) with the aim of producing an effect or making a statement rather than eliciting information

examples.text: "Did you really think I would just go away?" he asked rhetorically

shortDefinitions: with aim of producing effect rather than eliciting information
